user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_GetBaseForObjectType:
```c
uint32 OS_GetBaseForObjectType(osal_objtype_t idtype)
{
    switch (idtype)
    {
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK:
            return OS_TASK_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_QUEUE:
            return OS_QUEUE_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_BINSEM:
            return OS_BINSEM_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_COUNTSEM:
            return OS_COUNTSEM_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MUTEX:
            return OS_MUTEX_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM:
            return OS_STREAM_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_DIR:
            return OS_DIR_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE:
            return OS_TIMEBASE_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB:
            return OS_TIMECB_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MODULE:
            return OS_MODULE_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_FILESYS:
            return OS_FILESYS_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE:
            return OS_CONSOLE_BASE;
        case OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR:
            return OS_CONDVAR_BASE;
        default:
            return 0;
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_GetBaseForObjectType:
typedef uint32 osal_objtype_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TASK 0x01
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_QUEUE 0x02
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_BINSEM 0x04
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_COUNTSEM 0x03
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MUTEX 0x05
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_STREAM 0x06
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_DIR 0x07
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE 0x08
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMECB 0x09
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_MODULE 0x0A
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_FILESYS 0x0B
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONSOLE 0x0C
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR 0x0D
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Rule 8.13 concerns pointer types that should be const-qualified when possible. In the provided function and related definitions there are no pointer types or pointer operations to review: the function parameter osal_objtype_t and the return type are integer typedefs (uint32), the switch cases return integer macros (OS_*_BASE) or 0, and the shown typedefs/macros are integer constants. There are no '*' or '&' usages, no pointer casts, no pointer dereferences, and no pointer declarations in the supplied code fragments. Therefore there are no code fragments relevant to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 to investigate. (If any OS_*_BASE macros expand to pointer types in code not shown, those macro definitions would need to be checked, but they are not present in the provided snippets.)
